title: Sergei Rachmaninoff
summary: Sergei Vasilyevich Rachmaninoff[lower-alpha 1][lower-alpha 2] (1 April [O.S. 20 March] 1873[lower-alpha 3][lower-alpha 4] – 28 March 1943) was a Russian composer, virtuoso pianist, and conductor of the late Romantic period. The influence of Tchaikovsky, Rimsky-Korsakov, Balakirev, Mussorgsky, and other Russian composers is seen in his early works, later giving way to a personal style notable for song-like melodicism, expressiveness and rich orchestral colours.[5]
